user.biography: Greenpeace exists because this fragile earth deserves a voice. It needs solutions. It needs change. It needs action.

node.text:
Single-use plastics are on the rise. While their average usage time is only 6 months, it takes more than 500 years for plastic products to decompose. 

At the current rate, global plastic production is projected to double by 2030 compared to 2015. We must stop using single-use plastics that are polluting our land, sea, and even our dining table. 

Demand companies to cut down on single-use plastic production for a greener and more sustainable future for all.

🎥 : @greenpeacekorea 
.
.
#greenpeace #plastic #plasticfree #nature

node.text:
50 years since the first Greenpeace campaign, we continue to work alongside allies, volunteers, and supporters around the world toward a green and just future for people and the planet 💚 🌎

Every action and campaign up until now has prepared us for this moment, and inspired us to keep fighting 💪
.
.
#Greenpeace50 #GP50 #greenpeace #nature #environment

node.text:
For 50 years, Greenpeace has faced every challenge...every obstacle...every crisis with resolve. With a belief that we are writing the story of a safer, greener, more just future. That we are building a community for every believer, every dreamer and every hero who knows that we can save this planet. 

That we are working together to empower every person who has discovered their passion...who is yearning to find their voice. Every person who has found their reason to keep moving forward. 

To keep hoping. 

To keep dreaming. 

To keep fighting.

Check the link in our bio to learn what we’ve all achieved together in our first five decades of changing the world!

node.title: Keep fighting: Greenpeace 50 years of hope in action

node.text:
#MobilityWeek 2021 launches today 🎉

The transport sector is one of the biggest contributors to rising emissions and global warming. We have no more time to waste!

This European Mobility Week, we are mobilizing to demand a change in the design of our cities and towns, to reclaim space that has been gradually conquered by the car that we must take back now with a focus on climate mitigation, community, inclusion, and accessibility.

But no one should be left behind in the necessary transformation towards a climate-friendly mobility system. The mobility of the future is also socially just.

Let’s demand #MobilityForAll.

#mobilityforallnow #mobility #transport #citylife #cities #inclusion #socialjutice #climatejustice #publictransport #fightinequality #care #cars #lesscars #savepeoplenotplanes #cycling #movesustainably #stayhealthy #cleanair #airpollution #noisepollution #transformtransport #greencities

node.title: Mobility Week - Mobility should be climate-friendly and socially just!

node.text:
Fishermen on the outskirts of Matadi, in the Democratic Republic of Congo, say plastic is threatening their livelihoods. Not only does plastic pollution end up in their nets, but in the fish they catch. The most vulnerable communities are often impacted the worst by plastic pollution.
#PlasticFreeSeptember #BreakFreeFromPlastic

node.text:
50 years ago this month a crew of activists set out to sail into the path of a nuclear bomb blast and created Greenpeace. 
.
Over five decades – on all continents and oceans – together we have spoken truth to power, borne witness, stopped, blocked and placed our bodies in the way of environmental destruction. We have investigated and documented ecological contamination and crime. We have conducted scientific studies, litigated and lobbied. We have tried, failed and tried again. We have also succeeded!
.
As we commemorate, and celebrate, 50 years since the Greenpeace set sail, we are painfully aware of the gathering storm wrought by inequity, greed and corruption, of accelerating habitat destruction and the deepening climate emergency. We look to the past for learnings on how to face the future. We celebrate the passion and commitment of all who make Greenpeace possible 💚
.
.
#HopeInAction #GP50th #Greenpeace50

node.text:
Air pollution is a silent killer, responsible for an estimated 7 million deaths globally each year, and a leading cause of lung cancer, heart disease, stroke and asthma. 

But it is also a problem that we know how to solve, and we are demanding that governments take action. Join us in sharing your air pollution story using the hashtag #CleanAirNow. 
.
.
#WorldCleanAirDay #HealthyAirHealthyPlanet #airpollution #greenpeace

node.title: Tell us your air pollution story

.
.

node.text:
It’s one of the world’s most treasured natural jewels, but the Great Barrier Reef is losing its beautiful colours. 
.
This is what the coal industry is doing to one of Australia's most remarkable natural wonders.
.
.
#greenpeace #reef #GBR #Australia #climatechange #globalwarming

node.title: Great Barrier Reef is losing its beautiful colours.

node.text:
Earlier this week, thousands of Indigenous Peoples marched to the Brazilian Congress to symbolically demarcate Brasília with 1,296 signs representing all the Indigenous Lands claimed by Indigenous Peoples in Brazil, in a protest against the government's refusal on demarcating Indigenous Lands.
Around 6,000 Indigenous Peoples have gathered this week at the Struggle for Life camp to fight for their lands and lives. 
.
.
.
.
#StruggleForLife #IndigenousEmergency #MarcoTemporalNão

node.title: Protest for the Demarcation of Indigenous Lands in Brazil

node.text:
More than 5,000 Indigenous leaders from all over the country are meeting at the #StruggleforLife camp in Brasilia this week to defend their rights against the anti-Indigenous agenda that advances in Brazil’s Congress and await a critical Supreme Court decision that will define the future for their lives, their lands and for the environmental conservation in Brazil. Forests thrive when Indigenous Rights are respected✊
.
.
.
.
#IndigenousEmergency #LutaPelaVida #MarcoTemporalNão

node.title: Struggle for Life Camp 2021 in Brasília, Brazil

node.text:
If the world is on fire, you don’t throw more fuel on it.

That’s what we’re doing by allowing the expansion of fossil fuel production.

How about a non-proliferation treaty... on fossil fuels?

via @fossilfueltreaty

#fossilfueltreaty #nonproliferation #fossilfuels #bigoil #oilcompanies #climateemergency #climatecrisis #biodiversitycrisis #humanrights #climatejustice #solutions #coalphaseout #fossilfuelphaseout #energy #climate #climateaction

node.title: Towards a fossil fuel non-proliferation treaty?

node.text:
Single-use plastics are on the rise. While their average usage time is only 6 months, it takes more than 500 years for plastic products to decompose. 

At the current rate, global plastic production is projected to double by 2030 compared to 2015. We must stop using single-use plastics that are polluting our land, sea, and even our dining table. 

Demand companies to cut down on single-use plastic production for a greener and more sustainable future for all.

🎥 : @greenpeacekorea 
.
.
#greenpeace #plastic #plasticfree #nature

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Greenpeace International 🌍 on September 19, 2021. May be an image of one or more people, people standing, sky and text.

node.text:
Many of us are experiencing moments of grief and anxiety when it comes to the climate crisis. But there are reasons for HOPE. People power is real and it is strong ✊ Check the link in our bio to learn more. ⁠
.⁠
.⁠
.⁠
.⁠
⁠
#ClimateCrisis #Hope #ClimateChange #PeoplePower #Greenpeace⁠

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Greenpeace International 🌍 on September 19, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'WHICH CORPORATE POLLUTING VILLAINS ARE WORKING TOGETHER? Big Brands, like Coca-Cola, PepsiCo, Nestlé, Mondelez, Danone, Unilever, Colgate Palmolive, Procter & Gamble and Mars, all buy packaging from manufacturers supplied with plastic resin or petrochemicals by well-known companies like ExxonMobil, Shell, Chevron Phillips, Ineos and Dow. ©TimAubry/Greenpeace GREENPEACE'.

node.text:
The fossil fuel industry is increasingly pushing petrochemicals and single-use plastics.

Companies like @cocacola, @@pepsico, and @nestle are driving the expansion of plastic production and threatening the global climate.

Earlier this week, @greenpeace_usa released a report ⁠exposing that major Big Oil companies supply fossil fuels that become the petrochemicals used to make Big brands.

The plastic supply chain is often opaque. Greenpeace USA’s investigative team went above and beyond to trace back the supply chain of these notorious fossil fuel companies to each Big Brand's plastic bottles and packaging. 

The facts are out, and we won't stop until we cut out the fossil fuel industry's future —  single-use plastics —  by continuing to call out Big Brands' “climate-friendly” facade and expose them as the fossil fuel players that they actually are —  destroying the planet for profits and helping to fuel the climate crisis. 

Together, let’s break free from plastics and fossil fuels. 

👉 Check out the report and go to the link in our bio to take action now to demand Coke, Pepsi and Nestlé ditch single-use plastics and switch to reuse and refill solutions.

#BreakFreeFromPlastic

#climatecrisis #fossilfuels #exxonmobil #shell #chevron #ineos #dow #cocacola #nestle #pepsi #pepsico #bigoil #endoil #plasticcrisis #plastic #pollution #singleuseplastics #reduce #reuse #climateemergency #climatechange #health #publichealth #socialjustice #justtranstion #greenrecovery #justrecovery #environmentalhealth

node.text:
Rex Weyler served as photographer on Greenpeace campaigns from 1974 to 1982. Ahead of Greenpeace's 50th anniversary, he pulled a dozen photos from our archives and shared the memories that they evoke. Go to the link in our bio to read the stories.⁠
.⁠
.⁠
.⁠
.⁠
#HopeInAction #GP50th #Greenpeace50⁠

node.text:
We need real and meaningful change in urban mobility to help curb the climate crisis and build inclusive cities that work for the benefit of all ⚖️🌍

The transport sector is one of the biggest contributors to rising CO2 emissions and global warming (nearly 30% of CO2 emissions in the EU come from transport). No one should be left behind in this necessary transformation! 

Starting on September 16 and ending on World Car-Free Day on September 22, #MobilityWeek calls on European cities and towns to rethink sustainable mobility. This is a great opportunity to reinforce our demands on a national and international scale:

Better public transport 🚌
Sidewalks and public transport accessible to everyone, including people with physical disabilities 🧑‍🦽
Better cycling and walking infrastructure 🚴‍♀️
Car-free zones 🚗
More green public spaces 🍃

We need #MobilityForAll! 

More info about our demands and what we're doing for Mobility Week in our bio ☝️

#mobilityforallnow #mobility #transport #citylife #cities #inclusion #socialjutice #climatejustice #publictransport #fightinequality #care #cars #lesscars #savepeoplenotplanes #cycling #movesustainably #stayhealthy #cleanair #airpollution #noisepollution #transformtransport #greencities

node.text:
50 years since the first Greenpeace campaign, we continue to work alongside allies, volunteers, and supporters around the world toward a green and just future for people and the planet 💚 🌎

Every action and campaign up until now has prepared us for this moment, and inspired us to keep fighting 💪
.
.
#Greenpeace50 #GP50 #greenpeace #nature #environment

node.text:
For 50 years, Greenpeace has faced every challenge...every obstacle...every crisis with resolve. With a belief that we are writing the story of a safer, greener, more just future. That we are building a community for every believer, every dreamer and every hero who knows that we can save this planet. 

That we are working together to empower every person who has discovered their passion...who is yearning to find their voice. Every person who has found their reason to keep moving forward. 

To keep hoping. 

To keep dreaming. 

To keep fighting.

Check the link in our bio to learn what we’ve all achieved together in our first five decades of changing the world!

node.text:
Yesterday, Indonesian civil society and environmental groups won a citizen lawsuit against President Jokowi Widodo and other government officials who have been found liable for the poor air quality in the country’s capital Jakarta. 👏 👏 👏 

People have the right to #DemandCleanAir and to hold governments and corporations into account. 👆 👆 👆

 #HopeInAction #PeoplePower #GreenpeaceIndonesia #udarabersihhakwarga

node.text:
In the summer of 2015, protestors gathered at Shell's drilling ship, the Polar Pioneer, that had arrived in Elliot Bay near Seattle, Chicago, USA. Shell was preparing its equipment for oil exploration in the Alaskan Arctic. 
.
© @nstrimble).
.
50 years ago, a crew of activists set out to sail into the path of a nuclear bomb blast, and Greenpeace was born. This year, we would like to commemorate 50 years of hard lessons, sweet victories, and the incredible people who have always been the heart of Greenpeace. 

#Greenpeace50 #Greenpeace

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Greenpeace International 🌍 on September 16, 2021.

node.text:
An oil slick from the infamous Deepwater Horizon oil disaster, which occurred when an oil platform leased by British Petroleum exploded, burned, and sank into the ocean in 2010. 11 workers died during the disaster, and oil flowed from the well and into the Gulf of Mexico for 87 days. An estimated 800 million litres of oil and gas leaked from the broken pipeline and into the ocean. 
.
© @danielbeltraphoto
.
.
50 years ago, a crew of activists set out to sail into the path of a nuclear bomb blast, and Greenpeace was born. This year, we would like to commemorate 50 years of hard lessons, sweet victories, and the incredible people who have always been the heart of Greenpeace. 
.
#Greenpeace50 #Greenpeace

node.text:
#MobilityWeek 2021 launches today 🎉

The transport sector is one of the biggest contributors to rising emissions and global warming. We have no more time to waste!

This European Mobility Week, we are mobilizing to demand a change in the design of our cities and towns, to reclaim space that has been gradually conquered by the car that we must take back now with a focus on climate mitigation, community, inclusion, and accessibility.

But no one should be left behind in the necessary transformation towards a climate-friendly mobility system. The mobility of the future is also socially just.

Let’s demand #MobilityForAll.

#mobilityforallnow #mobility #transport #citylife #cities #inclusion #socialjutice #climatejustice #publictransport #fightinequality #care #cars #lesscars #savepeoplenotplanes #cycling #movesustainably #stayhealthy #cleanair #airpollution #noisepollution #transformtransport #greencities
